reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Maximizing efforts to control and eliminate Malaria in Somalia

description.narrative: Somalia - Malaria - United Nations Children's Fund - UNICEF. This program has the following goals: Ensure there is interruption of local Plasmodium falciparum transmission in 25% of the regions. Prepare 50% of regions for pre-elimination (malaria incidence <1 case per 1000) in which there has been historically low transmission. Reduce malaria case morbidity and mortality by 40% in endemic areas. The objectives of this program are: To consolidate the achievements of the previous NSPs. To maintain and increase equitable coverage of interventions for all at risk populations including internally displaced persons (IDPs) and mobile populations where geographically relevant. To enhance national surveillance systems and community based case management to promote an enabling environment in which to move towards malaria elimination in areas of continually low transmission.

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for SOM-M-UNICEF
Percentage of districts that produce periodic analytical report(s) as per nationally agreed plan and reporting format during the reporting period
Percentage of confirmed cases fully investigated and classified
CM-other 2a: Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment according to national policy at public sector health facilities (CSZ)
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
CM-other 1a: Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities (CSZ) (In sub-set of CM-1a)
M&E-other 1: Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines (CSZ)
Proportion of facility reports received over the reports expected during the reporting period
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Percentage of health facilities with tracer medicines for the three diseases available on the day of the visit or day of reporting
Impact indicator for SOM-M-UNICEF
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Annual parasite incidence: Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year (Elimination settings)
Malaria I-4-other: Malaria test positivity rate (northern parts of the country - NWZ and NEZ)
Malaria test positivity rate
Malaria I-4-other: Malaria test positivity rate (CSZ)
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Outcome indicator for SOM-M-UNICEF
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people and/or sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Malaria O-1a: Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net* the previous night (CSZ)
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of OPD visits attributed to Malaria
Malaria O-6: Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net* for every two people (CSZ)
Proportion of households with at least one insecticide-treated net for every two people
Percentage of existing ITNs used the previous night
